name: xwininfo
description_detailed: Xwininfo is a utility for displaying information about windows. Various information is displayed depending on which options are selected. If no options are chosen, -stats is assumed.

window_selection.description: The user can select the target window with the mouse by clicking any mouse button in the desired window.
The user can specify the window id on the command line with the -id option.
The user can specify which window is desired by name using the -name option.
The user can quickly obtain information on the screen's root window using the -root option.

options.description: Print out the 'Usage:' command syntax summary.
Specify a target window wdid on the command line rather than using the mouse to select the target window.
Specify that the window named wdname is the target window on the command line rather than using the mouse to select the target window.
Specify that X's root window is the target window.
Specify that all X window ids should be displayed as integer values. The default is to display them as hexadecimal values.
Display the root, parent, and children windows' ids and names of the selected window.
Like -children but displays all children recursively.
Display various attributes pertaining to the location and appearance of the selected window.
Display various attributes pertaining to the selected window's raw bits and how the selected window is to be stored.
Display the selected window's event masks.
Display the selected window's sizing hints.
Display the selected window's window manager hints.
Display the selected window's window and border shape extents.
Consider window manager frames when manually selecting windows.
Display all individual height, width, and x and y positions in millimeters as well as number of pixels.
Display all individual height, width, and x and y positions in inches (and feet, yards, and miles if necessary) as well as number of pixels.
A quick way to ask for all information possible.
Specify the server to connect to.
Print xwininfo's version information and exit.
